page.title: 14SOCIAL CONCERNS MORFA BYCHAN
page.content: The reappraisal of the National Health Service is a cause for concern. The ambulance service is facing a financial crisis and the future of the Madog Memorial Hospital in Porthmadog is currently in doubt.Petitions have been organised in the district against closure. Teh population of the village rises by 10000 during the summer months owing to the influx of holiday makers to the many caravan sites in the area. With the proximity of the sea and terrain of the land,accidents will happen;illness,sudden and long-term, will occur and residents and tourists alike need hospital facilities. The nearest well-equiped hospital is 33 miles distant in Bangor,Gwynedd.
